verses.verse: It came to pass that as the people pressed on him to hear the word of God, he stood by the Lake of Gennesaret,
and he saw two ships lying by the lake, but the fishermen were out of them washing their nets.
He got into one of the ships, which was Simon's, and asked him to go out a little from the land, and then he sat down and taught the people from the ship.
Now after he stopped speaking, he said to Simon, "Put out into the deep part and let down your nets for a fish catch."
Simon answering said to him, "Master, we have toiled all this night and have taken nothing, nevertheless, at your say so, I will let down the net."
After they had done this, they enclosed a large amount of fishes, and their net was breaking.
They motioned to their partners, who were in the other ship, so that they would come and help them. They came and filled both ships, so that they started to sink.
When Simon Peter saw [this], he fell down at Jesus' knees saying, "Leave me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord."
For he was amazed as all who were with him at the catch of fishes which they had taken.
And so were James and John, the sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Jesus said to Simon, "Don't be afraid, from now on you will catch men."
After they had brought their ships to land, they forsook all and followed him.
And so it happened when he was in a certain city, look, a man full of leprosy, who seeing Jesus fell on his face and pleaded with him, saying, "Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean."
He reached out his hand and touched him, saying, "I want to, be clean." Immediately the leprosy left him.
He ordered him, "Tell no one, but go and show yourself to the priest and offer for your cleansing as Moses commanded, for a testimony to them."
Instead even more his fame spread widely, and great crowds came together to hear and be healed by him of their sicknesses,
but he withdrew into the wilderness and prayed.

It came to pass on a certain day, as he was teaching (the Pharisees and doctors of the Law were sitting there, who had just come out of every town of Galilee, Judea, and Jerusalem) the power of the Lord was [present] to heal them.
And look, men carrying a man, who was paralyzed, in a bed; they looked for some way to bring him in and to lay [him] before him.
When they could not find a way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went on the housetop and let him down through the roofing tile with his bed into the midst in front of Jesus.
When he saw their faith, he said to him, "Man, your sins are forgiven you."
The Scribes and the Pharisees started to talk this over saying, "Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who can forgive sins, except God only?"
But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answered them, "Why are you talking this over in your hearts?
"Which is easier to say, "Your sins are forgiven you or to say: Get up and walk?
"But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins (he says to the paralyzed) I say to you: Get up, pick up your bed, and go to your house."
Immediately he got up in their presence, picked up what he was laying on, and left for his house praising God.
They were amazed, praised God, and filled with fear saying, "We have seen strange things today."
After these things, he went out and saw a tax collector, named Levi, sitting at the tax office, and said to him, "Follow me."
He left everything, got up, and followed him.
Levi then made him a great feast in his own house, and there were a large number of tax collectors and others who sat down with them.
But the Scribes and Pharisees complained about this to disciples saying, "Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?"
Jesus answered them, "Those who are well don't need a physician, only those who are sick.
"I didn't come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance."
They said to him, "Why do John's disciples often fast and make prayers like those of the Pharisees, but you eat and drink?"
He said to them, "Can you make the sons of the bridegroom fast as long as the bridegroom is with them?
"But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them and then will they fast in those days."
Then he also spoke a parable to them, "No one puts a piece of new cloth on old, for then both the new tears away and the piece taken from the new doesn't match the old.
"Also no one puts new wine into old skins, because the new wine will burst the wineskins, spill, and the wineskins ruined.
"But new wine must be put into new wineskins, then both are preserved.
"Also no one having drunk old wine, immediately wants new, because he says, «The old is better.»
